text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 3) (Income Disregard) 
Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2022 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2022. 

Commencement

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

In March 2021, the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and 
Control) (Amendment) (No. 10) (Income Disregard) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 
109 of 2021) introduced an income disregard for Disability Allowance recipients 
who have been awarded a bursary, stipend or scholarship towards completing a 
PhD. The disregard is subject to an annual limit of €20,000 per annum (i.e. if a 
recipient gets more than one bursary, the combination cannot exceed €20,000). 
The disregard is available for a maximum of four years. 

These Regulations, in line with Budget 2022, amend article 155 of the Social 
Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 
extend to those in receipt of Blind Pension the same disregard.
